title: How to Make Felt Dumplings

steps.headline: Measure out 3 inch (7.6 cm) diameter circles on the tan felt.
Gather the felt scraps and save them as the filling.
Hold the circle in your hand like a taco or burrito.
Place a small amount of scrap felt along the crease of the circle.
steps.description: Don't overfill it so you might want to add very small pieces.

steps.headline: Squeeze hot glue along the edge of the dumpling or sew it together.
steps.description: If you choose to sew the dumpling instead of using hot glue you will not have to go through the process of steps 6 and 7

steps.headline: Secure the two edges together with tweezers.
Place the dumpling on the side for it to dry.

text: Measure out 3 inch (7.6 cm) diameter circles on the tan felt.  Gather the felt scraps and save them as the filling.  Hold the circle in your hand like a taco or burrito.  Place a small amount of scrap felt along the crease of the circle. Don't overfill it so you might want to add very small pieces. Squeeze hot glue along the edge of the dumpling or sew it together. If you choose to sew the dumpling instead of using hot glue you will not have to go through the process of steps 6 and 7 Secure the two edges together with tweezers.  Place the dumpling on the side for it to dry.
